2year_colleges_access_scores:norm_2sefca.long_name: 2 year college access score (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
2year_colleges_access_scores:norm_2sefca.short_description: Index of 2-year college accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
2year_colleges_access_scores:norm_2sefca.long_description: 2-year college access score based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of college capacity per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which an institution is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for 2-year college (whole population in an area served by the institution) and supply is the total number of students enrolled in a year (graduate and undergraduate).
2year_colleges_access_scores:norm_2sefca.statement: The 2-year college accessibility score for {features.name} is {value}

drive_times_nearest_2year_colleges:media.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the five closest 2-year colleges
drive_times_nearest_2year_colleges:media.statement: The median drive time to the five closest 2-year colleges to {features.name} is {value} minutes

3rd_grade_median_read_score:median_read_.long_name: Median percent of 3rd grade population passing reading test
3rd_grade_median_read_score:median_read_.short_description: Median percent of 3rd grade population passing reading test for schools in the region
3rd_grade_median_read_score:median_read_.long_description: Median percent of 3rd grade population passing reading test. The median is calculated across schools in the region.
3rd_grade_median_read_score:median_read_.statement: The median percent of 3rd graders with passing reading scores in {features.name} is {value} percent

daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_n.long_name: Day care access score (3-step floating catchment area)
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_n.short_description: Index of day care accessibility based on supply of and demand for providers
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_n.long_description: Primary care access score based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data was collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. Demand = 0-12 years, supply = day care capacity
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_n.statement: The daycare accessibility score for {features.name} is {value}

daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_c.long_name: Access to day care by count
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_c.short_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_c.long_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations. Address  and capacity data was collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool.
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_c.statement: There are {value} day cares seats in {features.name}

drive_times_nearest_daycares:median_driv.long_name: Day care access by median drive time to the five closest day cares in minutes
drive_times_nearest_daycares:median_driv.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the five closest day cares
drive_times_nearest_daycares:median_driv.statement: The median drive time to the five closest day cares to {features.name} is {value} minutes

dei_index:norm_dei.short_description: Digital Equity Index captures the relative equity of digital access, with 0 being a score of relative equity and 100 being relative inequity.
dei_index:norm_dei.long_description: The Digital Equity Index captures the relative equity of digital access. The Digital Equity Index uses is a composite of measures of broadband infrastructure and adoption and socioeconomic variables, with 0 being a score of relative equity and 100 being relative inequity. The variables include x, y, z.
dei_index:norm_dei.statement: The digital equity index for {features.name} is {value}

citations.author: Robert Gallardo
citations.title: Digital Divide Index

dentist_access_scores:dent_e2sfca.long_name: Dental care access score (2 step-enhanced floating catchment areas)
dentist_access_scores:dent_e2sfca.short_description: Index of dental care accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
dentist_access_scores:dent_e2sfca.long_description: Dental care access score based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of dentists per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for dentists (population served by dentists). Provider address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
dentist_access_scores:dent_e2sfca.statement: The dental care access score for {features.name} is {value}

dentist_access_scores:dent_cnt.short_description: Count of dentists based on provider locations
dentist_access_scores:dent_cnt.long_description: Count of dentists based on provider locations. Address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.

download_speeds:download.short_description: Average download speed for internet connection in MB/s
download_speeds:download.long_description: The average download speed for internet users' connections who performed a speed check using Ookla. Speeds are reported in MB/s. A speed of 100 MB/s is considered adequate for school work, video calling etc.
download_speeds:download.statement: The average download speed for internet connections in {features.name} is {value} MB/s

trade_schools_access_scores:norm_2sefca.long_name: Trade school access score (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
trade_schools_access_scores:norm_2sefca.short_description: Index of trade school accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
trade_schools_access_scores:norm_2sefca.long_description: Trade school  access score based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of trade school capacity per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which an institution is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for trade schools (whole population in an area served by the institution) and supply is the total number of students enrolled in a year (undergraduate).
trade_schools_access_scores:norm_2sefca.statement: The trade school accessibility score for {features.name} is {value}

have_computer:perc_have_computer.short_description: Percent of the population self-reported to have a computer at home

health_literacy_estimates:health_literac.short_description: Health literacy estimate captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions
health_literacy_estimates:health_literac.long_description: The health literacy estimate captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions. Health literacy estimate is based on variables of demographic characteristics, health status, and health care use.
health_literacy_estimates:health_literac.statement: The health literacy estimate for {features.name} is {value}

no_health_insurance_19_to_64:no_hlth_ins.long_name: Percent of population without health insurance
no_health_insurance_19_to_64:no_hlth_ins.short_description: Percent of the population (ages 16-64) self-reported to not be currently covered by any type of health insurance or health coverage plan
no_health_insurance_19_to_64:no_hlth_ins.long_description: Percent of the population self-reported to not be currently covered by any type of health insurance or health coverage plan. This data comes from Question 16 of the Person section of the American Community Survey.
no_health_insurance_19_to_64:no_hlth_ins.statement: {value} percent of the population has no health insurance in {features.name}

obgyn_access_scores:obgyn_e2sfca.long_name: OBGYN care access score (2 step-enhanced floating catchment areas)
obgyn_access_scores:obgyn_e2sfca.short_description: Index of OBGYN care accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
obgyn_access_scores:obgyn_e2sfca.long_description: OBGYN care access score based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of OBGYNs per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for OBGYNs (population served by OBGYNs). Provider address data was collected from WebMD's online physician directory.
obgyn_access_scores:obgyn_e2sfca.statement: The OBGYN access score for {features.name}  is {value}

post_hs_education:perc_post_hs_edu.short_description: Percent of the population self-reported to have post-high school level degree

preventable_hospitalizations:prevent_hos.long_name: Preventable hospital stays per 100,000 Medicare enrollees
preventable_hospitalizations:prevent_hos.short_description: Rate of hospital stays for ambulatory-care sensitive conditions per 100,000 Medicare enrollees
preventable_hospitalizations:prevent_hos.long_description: Rate of hospital stays for ambulatory-care sensitive conditions per 100,000 Medicare enrollees. Ambulatory care refers to diagnoses that are usually treatable in outpatient settings. This data is based on Medicare claims and comes from County Health Rankings.
preventable_hospitalizations:prevent_hos.statement: {value} percent of the hospitalizations in {features.name}  were preventable (due to conditions usually treated in outpatient settings)

primary_care_access_scores:prim_e2sfca.long_name: Primary care access score (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
primary_care_access_scores:prim_e2sfca.short_description: Index of primary care physician accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
primary_care_access_scores:prim_e2sfca.long_description: Primary care access score based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of physicians per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for physicians (population served by physicians). Provider address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
primary_care_access_scores:prim_e2sfca.statement: The primary care accessibility score for {features.name}  is {value}
